channel.title: Guide on KS Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Guide on KS Blog

item.title: Android Spyware Development
item.description:
Prerequisite

  • Android Studio
  • kotlin
  • Android Emulator or physical devices
  • Discord as C2

I tested out this project in API 33 rooted device. Anything above API 33 might need to perform some modification to get everything works.

Creating the spyware

I created this project using Android Studio and Kotlin. This project took me around 16 hours to complete with massive help of GPT.

Part 0

I started off by creating a project in Android Studio by pressing New Project > Empty Activity and provide a name. It will have some generated code and function.

item.title: Android as Rubber Ducky
item.description:
Prerequisite

  • a physical android devices
    • rooted
    • termux app

As mentioned, the android devices must be rooted in order to work like a rubber ducky. I’ll be using my old devices that I have rooted as demonstration purposes.

Here’s a quick evidence that my devices is rooted.

Setting up

Now that the android devices is rooted, I’ll need to download some useful files and application that has been created by others
